item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, September 26, 2024 at 1:25 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Xkcd 1425 (Tasks) turns ten years old today (546 points | 228 comments)
2. Italian Music Through the Lens of Complex Networks (14 points | 2 comments)
3. Orion, our first true augmented reality glasses (1026 points | 794 comments)
4. Git-absorb: Git commit –fixup, but automatic (301 points | 148 comments)
5. Llama 3.2: Revolutionizing edge AI and vision with open, customizable models (705 points | 228 comments)
6. Octopuses seen hunting together with fish, punching those that don't cooperate (58 points | 12 comments)
7. Show HN: Cronexpr, a Rust library to parse and iter crontab expression (94 points | 18 comments)
8. Hoodmaps: Publicly Annotated City Maps (80 points | 32 comments)
9. Poka Labs (YC S24) Is Hiring a Founding Engineer ( | hide)
10. OpenAI to Become For-Profit Company (230 points | 116 comments)
11. Launch HN: Haystack (YC S24) – Visualize and edit code on an infinite canvas (279 points | 146 comments)
12. Eliminating Memory Safety Vulnerabilities at the Source (239 points | 113 comments)
13. The lost language extensions of MetaWare's High C compiler (2023) (275 points | 88 comments)
14. Shizuku: App that lets you use system APIs with higher privileges without root (38 points | 14 comments)
15. Register Allocation in the Go Compiler (39 points | 1 comment)
16. Another new wasp species discovered by researchers (7 points | 4 comments)
17. Writing Portable Rendering Code with Nvrhi (12 points | 1 comment)
18. Show HN: Httpdbg – A tool to trace the HTTP requests sent by your Python code (160 points | 46 comments)
19. GitHub-events-viewer a.k.a. "What did I do yesterday?" (43 points | 13 comments)
20. Timeshare owner? The Mexican drug cartels want you (197 points | 213 comments)
21. Why I still blog after 15 years (416 points | 208 comments)
22. How to avoid a BSOD on your 2B dollar spacecraft (148 points | 111 comments)
23. Rewriting Rust (287 points | 279 comments)
24. Rearchitecting: Redis to SQLite (307 points | 103 comments)
25. Moerenuma Park: A Giant, Gorgeous 'Living Sculpture' in Hokkaido (25 points | 5 comments)
26. Show HN: Coros – A Modern C++ Library for Task Parallelism (107 points | 47 comments)
27. Audio Masking (122 points | 18 comments)
28. Optimizing Guile Scheme (157 points | 63 comments)
29. Mira Murati leaves OpenAI (720 points | 500 comments)
30. Show HN: King Thirteen: 2048 with chess pieces, in under 13 KB (203 points | 61 comments)
